skills.name: Use the order of operations to carry out calculations involving addition, subtraction, multiplication, and/or division
Use the order of operations to carry out calculations involving powers
Use brackets to write function machines as calculations
Insert brackets to make a calculation correct

explanations.A: With order of operations brackets are done first, then division is done before subtraction. This would give us 16 - 10 ÷ 2 = 16 - 5 = 11 NOT 7.
explanations.B: With order of operations brackets are done first, then division is done before subtraction. This would give us 10 + 4 ÷ 2 = 10 + 2 = 12 NOT 7.
explanations.C: With order of operations brackets are done first, then division is done before subtraction. Putting the brackets around the division, will not change the order. 16 - 6 + (4 ÷ 2) = 16 - 6 + 2 = 12 NOT 7
explanations.D: Inside the bracket we work left to right, so we get 14 ÷ 2 which is 7

explanations.A: With order of operations brackets are done first, then division is done before subtraction. We would have 22 - 18 ÷ 4 = 22 - 4.5 = 17.5
explanations.B: Did adding in brackets here change the order at all?
explanations.C: Inside the bracket we work left to right, so we get 20 ÷ 4 which is 5
explanations.D: Did adding in brackets here change the order at all?

explanations.A: Out of addition and multiplication, which do you do first?
explanations.B: Out of addition and division, which do you do first?
explanations.C: Division is done before addition, so we have 10 + 22 = 32
explanations.D: Out of subtraction and multiplication, which do you do first?

explanations.A: Division is done before addition, so we have 36 + 9 = 45
explanations.B: Out of addition and division, which do you do first?
explanations.C: Out of addition and multiplication, which do you do first?
explanations.D: Out of subtraction and multiplication, which do you do first?

explanations.A: Inside these brackets are two operations. Which would you do first?
explanations.B: Out of subtraction and multiplication, which do you do first?
explanations.C: We need brackets to tell us to do the subtraction before the multiplication.
explanations.D: Did adding in brackets here change the order at all?

explanations.A: Did adding in brackets here change the order at all?
explanations.B: We need brackets to tell us to do the addition before the division.
explanations.C: Out of addition and division, which do you do first?
explanations.D: Inside these brackets are two operations. Which would you do first?

explanations.A: Think about your order of operations. What operations are there here?
explanations.B: Out of indices and multiplication, which do you do first?
explanations.C: Indices are done before multiplication, and multiplication is done before addition.
explanations.D: Think about the order of operations. What does BIDMAS mean?

explanations.A: Indices are done before division, and division is done before subtraction.
explanations.B: Out of indices and division, which do you do first?
explanations.C: Think about your order of operations. What operations are there here?
explanations.D: What does order of operations mean? Try doing the calculation in different orders.

explanations.A: Think about your order of operations. What operations are there here?
explanations.B: The numerator acts as though it is in a bracket, so we have to work out the top of the fraction first. There are two operations in the numerator, + and x, we need to do the x first.

explanations.A: The numerator acts as though it is in a bracket, so we have to work out the top of the fraction first. There are two operations in the numerator, + and - but these are equal priority so we work from left to right.
explanations.B: Even though BIDMAS lists addition before subtraction, they are actually the same priority. We work from left to right.
